author: Staff Reporter
text:
In view of the Republic Day celebrations on January 26 at the Indira Gandhi Sports Complex, Uppalam, the Superintendent of Police (Traffic) has issued an appeal to invitees to the programme and the public to follow arrangements made for the day.

Those with invitation cards have been requested to enter the venue through the Vambakeerapalayam Road, while those with car passes should use Gate no. 1 on Vambakeerapalayam Road.

Those without car passes should park their vehicles at Uppalam Port. Students participating in the march past should park their two-wheelers or cycles inside the premises of the ITI for women on Vambakeerapalayam Road opposite the Indira Gandhi Sports Complex.

The invitees and the public have been requested not to bring any hand bag, food packets, water bottles, cameras, cell phones or any other baggage. They have been requested to cooperate with security officials during checking and frisking.

The invitees are to be seated before 8 a.m. The public are requested to remain seated at the end of the programme and wait till the VIPs leave the venue.

Members of the public wishing to attend are requested to enter the venue from Ambedkar Salai (Uppalam Road). For the public, arrangements for parking of two-wheelers have been made at the Petit Seminaire Primary School ground. Cars and other vehicles of the public are to be parked at the Uppalam Exhibition Ground. Women and children have been requested to occupy the enclosures marked for them. The public must take their seats by 8 a.m. to avoid last minute rush.

Owing to heavy rush on the Beach Road, vehicles including cycles will not be allowed to ply on the road from 6 a.m. to 1.30 p.m. The roads around the Bharathi Park will be closed to vehicular traffic from 3 p.m. to 10 p.m.
title: Traffic arrangements for R-Day
